priorVersion.title: CDISC SEND Tumor Findings Histopathology Result Category Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C90004

self.title: CDISC SEND Tumor Findings Histopathology Result Category Terminology

definition: Terminology related to the classifications of the results from a histopathological analysis of a tumor.
name: Neoplastic Status
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Tumor Findings Histopathology Result Category Terminology

terms.definition: For neoplasms, a non-infiltrating and non-metastasizing neoplastic process that is characterized by the absence of morphologic features associated with malignancy (e.g., severe atypia, nuclear pleomorphism, tumor cell necrosis, and abnormal mitoses). For other conditions, a process that is mild in nature and not dangerous to health. (NCI)
Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host. (NCI)
A term referring to the pathologic observation of a tumor extension or migration from its original site of growth to another non-adjacent site.
A term referring to the lack of definitive clinical or pathologic criteria for a tumor to predict its clinical course or classify it as benign or malignant.
